qas.question: Where can Windows 8 install apps from?
How do devices with Windows 8 Enterprise attain apps outside of the Windows Store?
What other devices can sideload apps?

answers.text: Windows 8 Pro and Windows RT devices

qas.question: Where can't Windows 8 install apps from?
Where can Windows 9 install apps from?
How do devices with Windows 9 Enterprise attain apps outside of the Windows Store?
How do devices with Windows 8 Enterprise attain apps inside of the Windows Store?

plausible_answers.text: Windows 8 Pro and Windows RT devices

qas.question: What other devices can't sideload apps?

context: Retail versions of Windows 8 are only able to install these apps through <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>Windows Store<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/>—a namesake distribution platform which offers both apps, and listings for desktop programs certified for comparability with Windows 8. A method to <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>sideload apps<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> from outside Windows Store is available to devices running Windows 8 Enterprise and joined to a domain; <a2_0><b7_0>Windows 8 Pro and Windows RT devices<b7_0/><a2_0/> that are not part of a domain can also sideload apps, but only after special product keys are obtained through volume licensing.
